Timeline of critical events

1973

University President William McGill

is appointed to the board of Texaco.

1974

Barnard President Martha Peterson

is appointed to the board of Exxon.

Aug. 8, 1979

Esso Atlantic project begins, with

Garvey overseeing the equipping

of the tanker.

July 1982

Exxon makes significant cuts to its

climate research program.

1980s–early 1990s

Exxon continues to direct funding to

climate research at Columbia.

2015

Columbia Journalism School Energy

and Environment Reporting Project

journalists conduct an investigation

into what Exxon knew about the

impact of the company’s operations

on the climate.

July 2020

Columbia Climate School is founded.

January 2021

Columbia board of trustees approves

formal fossil fuel policy.

Source: Spectator Reporting

Illustration by Macy Sinreich

Graphic by Wilson Zhen

Timeline of critical events

1973

University President William McGill

is appointed to the board of Texaco.

1974

Barnard President Martha Peterson

is appointed to the board of Exxon.

Aug. 8, 1979

Esso Atlantic project begins, with

Garvey overseeing the equipping

of the tanker.

July 1982

Exxon makes significant cuts to its

climate research program.

1980s–early 1990s

Exxon continues to direct funding to

climate research at Columbia.

2015

Columbia Journalism School Energy

and Environment Reporting Project

journalists conduct an investigation

into what Exxon knew about the

impact of the company’s operations

on the climate.

July 2020

Columbia Climate School is founded.

January 2021

Columbia board of trustees approves

formal fossil fuel policy.
